metadata.Title: CVE-2021-2007 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Client product of Oracle MySQL (component: C API). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.47 and prior, 5.7.29 and prior and 8.0.19 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Client. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Client accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 3.7 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-2007` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-client - 8.0.21-1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-router - 8.0.21-1
mysql-server - 8.0.21-1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.21-1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.21-1').
